verses.kjv: Come down, and sit in the dust, O virgin daughter of Babylon, sit on the ground: there is no throne, O daughter of the Chaldeans: for thou shalt no more be called tender and delicate.
verses.web: “Come down and sit in the dust, virgin daughter of Babylon. Sit on the ground without a throne, daughter of the Chaldeans. For you will no longer be called tender and delicate.
verses.ct: Come down from your throne and sit in the dust, Babylon — you who were once like a pampered young woman. Sit on the bare ground, daughter of the Chaldeans, because your throne is gone. No one will ever call you tender and delicate again.

verses.kjv: Take the millstones, and grind meal: uncover thy locks, make bare the leg, uncover the thigh, pass over the rivers.
verses.web: Take the millstones and grind flour. Remove your veil, lift up your skirt, uncover your legs, and wade through the rivers.
verses.ct: Pick up the millstones and grind flour like a servant. Strip off your veil, hike up your skirt, bare your legs, and wade through the rivers.

verses.kjv: Thy nakedness shall be uncovered, yea, thy shame shall be seen: I will take vengeance, and I will not meet thee as a man.
verses.web: Your nakedness will be uncovered. Yes, your shame will be seen. I will take vengeance, and will spare no one.”
verses.ct: Your nakedness will be exposed, and your shame will be on full display. I will take vengeance, and no one will be spared.

verses.kjv: As for our redeemer, the LORD of hosts is his name, the Holy One of Israel.
verses.web: Our Redeemer, LORD of Armies is his name, is the Holy One of Israel.
verses.ct: Our Redeemer — the LORD of hosts is his name — is the Holy One of Israel.

verses.kjv: Sit thou silent, and get thee into darkness, O daughter of the Chaldeans: for thou shalt no more be called, The lady of kingdoms.
verses.web: “Sit in silence, and go into darkness, daughter of the Chaldeans. For you shall no longer be called the mistress of kingdoms.
verses.ct: Sit in silence and disappear into the darkness, daughter of the Chaldeans. No one will ever again call you the mistress of kingdoms.

verses.kjv: I was wroth with my people, I have polluted mine inheritance, and given them into thine hand: thou didst shew them no mercy; upon the ancient hast thou very heavily laid thy yoke.
verses.web: I was angry with my people. I profaned my inheritance and gave them into your hand. You showed them no mercy. You laid a very heavy yoke on the aged.
verses.ct: I was angry with my people. I treated my own inheritance as common and handed them over to you. But you showed them no mercy — you crushed even the elderly under your heavy yoke.

verses.kjv: And thou saidst, I shall be a lady for ever: so that thou didst not lay these things to thy heart, neither didst remember the latter end of it.
verses.web: You said, ‘I will be a princess forever,’ so that you didn’t lay these things to your heart, nor did you remember the results.
verses.ct: You said, 'I will be queen forever.' You never took any of this to heart. You never stopped to think about how it would end.

verses.kjv: Therefore hear now this, thou that art given to pleasures, that dwellest carelessly, that sayest in thine heart, I am, and none else beside me; I shall not sit as a widow, neither shall I know the loss of children:
verses.web: “Now therefore hear this, you who are given to pleasures, who sit securely, who say in your heart, ‘I am, and there is no one else besides me. I won’t sit as a widow, neither will I know the loss of children.’
verses.ct: So listen carefully, you who live for pleasure, you who sit so secure, telling yourself, 'I am the one, and there is no one besides me. I will never be a widow, and I will never lose my children.'

verses.kjv: But these two things shall come to thee in a moment in one day, the loss of children, and widowhood: they shall come upon thee in their perfection for the multitude of thy sorceries, and for the great abundance of thine enchantments.
verses.web: But these two things will come to you in a moment in one day, the loss of children and widowhood. They will come on you in their full measure, in the multitude of your sorceries, and the great abundance of your enchantments.
verses.ct: Both of these disasters will hit you in a single moment, on the same day — the loss of your children and widowhood. They will crash down on you in full force, despite all your sorceries and the overwhelming power of your enchantments.

verses.kjv: For thou hast trusted in thy wickedness: thou hast said, None seeth me. Thy wisdom and thy knowledge, it hath perverted thee; and thou hast said in thine heart, I am, and none else beside me.
verses.web: For you have trusted in your wickedness. You have said, ‘No one sees me.’ Your wisdom and your knowledge has perverted you. You have said in your heart, ‘I am, and there is no one else besides me.’
verses.ct: You trusted in your own wickedness. You told yourself, 'No one sees what I do.' Your wisdom and knowledge twisted you, and you declared in your heart, 'I am the one, and there is no one besides me.'

verses.kjv: Therefore shall evil come upon thee; thou shalt not know from whence it riseth: and mischief shall fall upon thee; thou shalt not be able to put it off: and desolation shall come upon thee suddenly, which thou shalt not know.
verses.web: Therefore disaster will come on you. You won’t know when it dawns. Mischief will fall on you. You won’t be able to put it away. Desolation will come on you suddenly, which you don’t understand.
verses.ct: Because of this, disaster will strike you, and you won't see it coming. Calamity will fall on you, and you won't be able to ward it off. Destruction will sweep over you suddenly — something you never imagined.

verses.kjv: Stand now with thine enchantments, and with the multitude of thy sorceries, wherein thou hast laboured from thy youth; if so be thou shalt be able to profit, if so be thou mayest prevail.
verses.web: “Stand now with your enchantments and with the multitude of your sorceries, in which you have labored from your youth, as if you might profit, as if you might prevail.
verses.ct: Go ahead — keep relying on your enchantments and your countless sorceries that you've practiced since you were young. Maybe they'll help you. Maybe they'll scare off what's coming.

verses.kjv: Thou art wearied in the multitude of thy counsels. Let now the astrologers, the stargazers, the monthly prognosticators, stand up, and save thee from these things that shall come upon thee.
verses.web: You are wearied in the multitude of your counsels. Now let the astrologers, the stargazers, and the monthly prognosticators, stand up and save you from the things that will happen to you.
verses.ct: You've exhausted yourself chasing advice from every direction. Let your astrologers step forward now — your stargazers, your fortune-tellers who predict the future month by month. Let them stand up and save you from what's about to happen.

verses.kjv: Behold, they shall be as stubble; the fire shall burn them; they shall not deliver themselves from the power of the flame: there shall not be a coal to warm at, nor fire to sit before it.
verses.web: Behold, they are like stubble. The fire will burn them. They won’t deliver themselves from the power of the flame. It won’t be a coal to warm at or a fire to sit by.
verses.ct: Look at them — they're nothing but dry stubble. Fire will consume them. They can't even save themselves from the flames. This won't be a warm coal to sit beside or a cozy fire to enjoy — it will be total destruction.

verses.kjv: Thus shall they be unto thee with whom thou hast laboured, even thy merchants, from thy youth: they shall wander every one to his quarter; none shall save thee.
verses.web: The things that you labored in will be like this: those who have trafficked with you from your youth will each wander in his own way. There will be no one to save you.
verses.ct: That's what will become of all the people you've done business with, the merchants you've traded with since your youth. Every one of them will scatter in their own direction, and not a single one will be left to save you.
